definition: common program/formal program of the communist party after 1949, that served as interim national plan
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
head rope of a fishing net/guiding principle/key link/class (taxonomy)/outline/program
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: The Montagnards had no common programme generally acknowledged by all its members.
sentences.chinese: 山嶽派沒有被認可的共同綱領。

sentences.english: Common Program of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, article 28.
sentences.chinese: 《中國人民政治協商會議共同綱領》第28條。
